node.title: Man charged after crash near Timaru that caused death of five teens
node.description: A 19-year-old man has been charged following a horror crash near Timaru in August that took the lives of five teenagers.

node.title: Invercargill street upgrade on hold after chemicals found
node.description: An Invercargill city centre street upgrade is facing further delays after low levels of cyanide and a mix of heavy metals were discovered during earthworks.

node.title: Judge blocks Biden vaccine mandate for federal contractors
node.description: A federal judge in Georgia issued a stay Tuesday to bar enforcement of the mandate nationwide.

node.title: Adolescent Anorexia Up 65 Percent in Canada During First Wave of Pandemic, Study Finds
node.description: Researchers said the lockdowns and increased social media use could've triggered young people's eating disorders.

node.title: China Stays Hushed, IOC Mum on Peng Shuai Case as Beijing Olympics Loom
node.description: The International Olympic Committee said it needs "to be discreet" when talking about this case while the Beijing Olympics are set to begin in February.

node.title: First Gas Group unveils plans for large-scale biogas project
node.description: The country's biggest gas distributor has announced plans to help transform kerbside waste into energy for homes and businesses.

node.title: For the Giants, It’s Always Fourth-and-Too-Far
node.description: The Giants’ risk-averse offense may be as much to blame as injuries for the team’s 4-8 record.

node.title: Lauren Boebert Backs Thomas Massie With Family Gun Photo: 'No Spare Ammo for You, Though'
node.description: The photo appeared to attract significant criticism on social media.

node.title: First case of Covid-19 reported in Taumarunui
node.description: Health providers and iwi are well prepared for Covid-19 in the Taumarunui community, says Ruapehu District mayor Don Cameron.

node.title: Plan to stop domestic and sexual violence 'only a start'
node.description: Women's Refuge says time will tell if the newly announced 25-year plan to tackle domestic and sexual violence will work.

node.title: 71 Percent of Democrats in College Wouldn't Date a Trump Voter, Poll Finds
node.description: This is compared to 31 percent of Republicans who felt the same way about a Biden voter.

node.title: First Gas Group unveals plans for large-scale biogas project
node.description: The country's biggest gas distributor has announced plans to help transform kerbside waste into energy for homes and businesses.

node.title: Auckland boundary two-week delay 'not material in terms of the risk' - Bloomfield
node.description: The decision to keep Auckland's boundary closed for two weeks after the traffic light system began was not justified from a public health perspective, Ashley Bloomfield has told a select committee.

node.title: Covid-19: 90 new community cases in New Zealand today
node.description: There are 90 new cases of Covid-19 in the community today, the Ministry of Health has reported.

node.title: Covid-19 response: 'It is not partnership when Crown ignores advice'
node.description: The Waitangi Tribunal has heard that authorities were told early on that the vaccine rollout would need a whānau focus but Māori providers were rebuffed.

node.title: The uninvited Christmas guest: is New Zealand prepared for Omicron’s inevitable arrival?
node.description: Opinion - As New Zealand gets ready for the festive season under the new traffic light system, the emergence of the Omicron variant is a reminder this pandemic is far from over.

node.title: Navy ordered to take further action on water contamination in Hawaii
node.description: Residents say the water has contributed to an array of health problems like vomiting, diarrhea and skin irritation.

node.title: Former Theranos CEO Elizabeth Holmes Again Has Hard Time Remembering Things on Witness Stand
node.description: Like the previous week, attorney Robert Leach pulled up Holmes' own emails ranging from six to nine years ago, attempting to aid Holmes in jogging her memory.

node.title: House Approves Mitch McConnell's Plan To Have His Cake and Eat It on the Debt Ceiling
node.description: The House voted 222-212 for a framework that would allow Senate Democrats to raise the debt ceiling vote through a simple majority vote.

node.title: Rose McGowan's Lawsuit Against Harvey Weinstein Dismissed After She Again Misses Deadlines
node.description: After firing her attorneys last month and missing deadlines to refile charges, a federal judge has dismissed Rose McGowan's lawsuit against Harvey Weinstein.

node.title: House Passes Defense Authorization Bill 363-70, Now Heads to Senate
node.description: The $768 billion defense bill will fund the U.S. military in the new year and also reform the military judicial system.

node.title: DOJ Announces US Navy Seized Iranian Terrorist Arms Shipments Bound for Militants in Yemen
node.description: "The actions of the United States in these two cases strike a resounding blow to the government of Iran," the DOJ said.

node.title: Trampers urged to stay grouped together after death in Arthur's Pass
node.description: Trampers are being urged to stick together following the death of a Russian man in a fall in Arthur's Pass National Park in 2019.

node.title: Hollywood Still Matters. This Year’s Best Actors Showed Why.
node.description: Even as theaters suffer, cinema has been thriving during the pandemic — thanks to the intimacy movies create between performer and audience.

node.title: Strike By A Thousand-Plus Kellogg's Workers to Continue After They Reject Company's Offer
node.description: The declined five-year offer included cost-of-living adjustments in the latter years of the deal and kept the current healthcare benefits.

node.title: Biden Withdraws Banking Nominee Saule Omarova After GOP Pushback and Modest Dem Support
node.description: Concerns from Republicans over her thoughts on banking regulations and her birth in the former Soviet Union led Omarova to request the nomination be withdrawn.

node.title: Foodstuffs North Island says some Commerce Commission proposals unjustified
node.description: Foodstuffs North Island says a number of recommendations proposed by the Commerce Commission to improve competition in the retail grocery sector are not justified.

node.title: Price pressure shifts to higher valued housing - QV
node.description: The latest round of house valuations indicates a shift in the market with an increasing number of homes failing to sell at auction. Audio

node.title: Whistleblower describes 'chaos' of UK Afghan exit
node.description: Thousands of pleas for help went unread and the foreign secretary lacked urgency, an ex-official says.

node.title: Review: ‘Harry Potter’ Back Onstage, Streamlined and Still Magical
node.description: “Harry Potter and the Cursed Child” returned to Broadway, now in one part instead of two. It may feel smaller, but is no less dazzling.
